pageContext.claim: “The same worker was instructed not to ask for any voter ID and not to attempt to validate any signatures if they were Democrats.”
pageContext.analysis: "A Michigan judge on Nov. 13 already found Jessy Jacob’s presentation was unpersuasive. "Jacob could not have verified signatures while working at TCF because that's not where signature verification took place," noted the Detroit Free Press. "It took place at the city clerk's office before ballots were sent to TCF. Jacob also said she was told to pre-date absentee ballots that were received after the 8 p.m. Election Day deadline."
